title: Dividing Exponents
text: If two exponent expressions in a quotient have the same base (ex: (x**a)/(x**b)) then this is the same as $$x^{a-b}$$
speech: If two exponent expressions in a quotient have the same base (ex: (x**a)/(x**b)) then this is the same as , x raised to the a minus b power

title: Rewriting the Expression in the Root
text: We can rewrite the expression under the root such that it is some $$x^4$$, such that $$x^4$$ is equal to whatever $$\frac{a^{10}}{a^2}$$ simplifies to. Remember that we do this because $$\sqrt[n]{x^n}$$ is just $$|x|$$.

title: Absolute Value of a Square
text: Because the square of all numbers is positive, $$|x^2|$$ can be rewritten as $$x^2$$
